unnormalised: A Delhi court has extended the judicial custody of Manish Sisodia, ex-Dy CM, till 10/07/2024 in connection with the alleged excise policy scam. Adv. Singh, representing the CBI, argued that further investigation is needed.
normalised: A Delhi court has extended the judicial custody of Manish Sisodia, ex-Deputy C M, till tenth july two thousand and twenty four in connection with the alleged excise policy scam. Advocate Singh, representing the C B I, argued that further investigation is needed.

unnormalised: The court also heard arguments on the bail application of accused no. 5, Vijay Nair. Nair’s lawyer, Adv. Sharma, claimed his client's innocence, citing lack of concrete evidence. Judge Gupta reserved the order for 28/06/2024.
normalised: The court also heard arguments on the bail application of accused number five, Vijay Nair. Nair’s lawyer, Advocate Sharma, claimed his client's innocence, citing lack of concrete evidence. Judge Gupta reserved the order for twenty eighth june two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, sources indicate that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth Rs. 86 crore belonging to several individuals and entities allegedly involved in money laundering related to the same case. The investigation is ongoing, and more arrests are likely, said a source in the ED.
normalised: Meanwhile, sources indicate that the Enforcement Directorate (E D) has attached assets worth rupee eighty six crore belonging to several individuals and entities allegedly involved in money laundering related to the same case. The investigation is ongoing, and more arrests are likely, said a source in the E D.

unnormalised: Folks online are saying this whole thing is a political game. Some are even questioning why it's taking so long. Guess we'll just have to wait and see what happens!
normalised: Folks online are saying this whole thing is a political game. Some are even questioning why it's taking so long. Guess we'll just have to wait and see what happens!
